metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17543 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
LZ4 before 1.9.2 has a heap-based buffer overflow in LZ4_write32 (related to LZ4_compress_destSize), affecting applications that call LZ4_compress_fast with a large input. (This issue can also lead to data corruption.) NOTE: the vendor states "only a few specific / uncommon usages of the API are at risk."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17543` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblz4-1 - 0.0~r131-2ubuntu2
liblz4-tool - 0.0~r131-2ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code is different in bionic and earlier, no indication that it is vulnerable to this issue.

criterions.comment: lz4 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.0~r131-2ubuntu2').
